snippet: Even as the Palestinian leadership took formal steps on Wednesday to gain the benefits of statehood outside the negotiation process, the parties appeared ready to seek a formula for continuing the negotiations.
abstract: Palestinian leadership formally submits applications to join 15 international conventions and treaties despite opposition from United States and Israel, reflecting a deep crisis in Middle East peace talks; yet all three parties appear ready to seek a formula for continuing negotiations.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN, ISABEL KERSHNER and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren and Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Michael R. Gordon from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Even as the Palestinian leadership took formal steps on Wednesday to gain the benefits of statehood outside the negotiation process, the parties appeared ready to seek a formula for continuing the negotiations.

headline.main: Hope for Negotiations Stays Alive in Mideast
headline.print_headline: Hope for Negotiations Stays Alive in Mideast
